Tutorial for compressing your own videos using handbrake (if you want)
First, download and install it, then go to options, to set the default path
tools -> options -> output files -> Default path
set the default path: {source_path}handbrake
this means, a folder named "handbrake" will be created in the source folder (of your video files), where all converted videos will be saved
press Close, to return to main window

now you're ready
1. select source -> folder (it's best to use folder, not file. wait while the folder is scanned)
2. load preset with audio/video settings, if you saved one
   if no preset or it's your first time, then create it now
   2.1. in video tab, choose:
        * constant quality: 23
        * x264 tune: still image
        * everything else default
   2.2. in audio tab, choose bitrate 80 (it's enough)
   2.3. save this preset (press Add, give it a descriptive name, like "ttc")
        next time, you just load the preset
        or, even better, set "ttc" preset as default (through Options button near Add button)
3. now, use the down arrow on the button "Add To Queue" -> Add All
4. Start
   or "Show Queue" -> Start

Now, if instead of compressing videos, you want actually to convert videos into mp3s,
handbrake doesn't know how (at least as of this date)
So, the alternative for this, the easiest, is to use: 
http://www.pazera-software.com/products/audio-extractor/
